items.title: Immigration Tripled in Top U.S. Counties Even as Many of Them Lost Population
items.abstract: New census data reveals where people are moving to — and from. And it reveals one exception to current trends: Manhattan.

items.title: In Rural Ukraine, Medicine and Hope Roll In on a Truck
items.abstract: A mobile clinic is trying to restore medical services to villages once occupied by Russian forces as fighting rages nearby. “They’ll never beat our people,” a specialist with the team said.

items.title: Why Black Families Are Leaving New York, and What It Means for the City
items.abstract: Black children in particular are disappearing from the city, and many families point to one reason: Raising children here has become too expensive.

items.title: Austin’s Black Population Leaving City, Report Says
items.abstract: Among large, fast-growing cities, Austin is the only one with a shrinking African-American population, according to a recent study.

items.title: In Cities With West African Populations, Hospitals Take Extra Steps
items.abstract: Patient screening, protections for hospital employees and efforts to encourage people to report symptoms and take precautions are being put in place.
